Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to provide a list of organizations they consult with on chronic diseases
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to provide a list of organizations they consult with on chronic diseases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the placement of automated, self-administered blood pressure testing machines at certain public places
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the placement of automated, self-administered blood pressure testing machines at certain public places.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a standard procedure for treating students presenting with suspected tick bites
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Standard procedure for treating students presenting with suspected tick bites.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring the last day in February as Rare Disease Day in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring the last day in February as Rare Disease Day in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to amend the Education Law to require more than one school staff person to be trained to administer CPR at all schools during regular school hours.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require more than one school staff person to be trained to administer CPR at all schools during regular school hours.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring the fourth week in May as Stroke Awareness Week in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring the fourth week in May as Stroke Awareness Week in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the state of New York to provide blood pressure machines in public places throughout the state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: NYS to provide blood pressure machines in public places throughout the state.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the first week of this and every February as Heart Disease Awareness Week in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Recognizing the first week of this and every February as Heart Disease Awareness Week in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and fully fund, and the Governor to sign, A.6493/S.2281, legislation that would establish eight demonstration programs throughout New York State and one coordinating center to improve the care of sickle cell disease patients and educate about sickle cell trait
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Sickle Cell Awareness (A.6493/S.2281)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Department of Health and Human Services and the New York State Department of Health to create a special commission to address health emergencies and infectious diseases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: US Dept of Health and Human Services and the NYS Dept of Health to create a special commission to address health emergencies and infectious diseases.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring June 19 of each year Sickle Cell Awareness Day in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring June 19 Sickle Cell Awareness Day in NYC.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Dromm and Miller
